statements: SELECT id, feature_1, feature_2, feature_3 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml
SELECT feature_1, feature_2, feature_3, id FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml ORDER BY feature_1 DESC
SELECT * FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml WHERE feature_1 > 0.5
SELECT id, feature_1, feature_3 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml WHERE feature_2 < 0.3
SELECT * FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml ORDER BY feature_3 ASC
SELECT id, feature_1, feature_2, feature_3 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml;
SELECT feature_1, feature_2, feature_3 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml WHERE id > 5;
SELECT * FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml WHERE feature_1 > 0.5 AND feature_2 < 0.3;
SELECT id, feature_1, feature_2 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml WHERE feature_3 IS NULL;
SELECT id, feature_2 FROM sampling_techniques_for_ml ORDER BY feature_1 DESC, id ASC;
SELECT * FROM SamplingTechniques;
SELECT data_id, data_value, label FROM SampledData;
SELECT technique_name, description FROM SamplingTechniques WHERE technique_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM SampledData WHERE data_value > 50 ORDER BY data_value DESC;
SELECT technique_name, COUNT(*) AS num_samples FROM SampledData JOIN SamplingTechniques ON SampledData.technique_id = SamplingTechniques.technique_id GROUP BY technique_name;
SELECT * FROM SamplingTechniques WHERE technique_id = 1
SELECT technique_name, description FROM SamplingTechniques ORDER BY technique_name DESC
SELECT data_id, data_value, label FROM SampledData WHERE technique_id = 2 ORDER BY data_id ASC
SELECT technique_name, description FROM SamplingTechniques WHERE description IS NOT NULL
SELECT * FROM SampledData ORDER BY label ASC
SELECT * FROM data_sampling_techniques;
SELECT label, feature_1 FROM data_sampling_techniques WHERE feature_2 > 0.5;
SELECT method_name, description FROM sampling_methods ORDER BY method_id DESC;
SELECT metric_name, result FROM sampling_metrics WHERE calculation_method = 'mean';
SELECT * FROM sampling_metrics WHERE result < 0.75 ORDER BY metric_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM data_sampling_techniques WHERE label = 'A' ORDER BY feature_1 DESC;
SELECT feature_1, feature_2, label FROM data_sampling_techniques WHERE feature_2 > 0.5;
SELECT * FROM data_sampling_techniques WHERE id IN (1, 2, 3) ORDER BY label ASC;
SELECT method_name, description FROM sampling_methods WHERE method_id = 1;
SELECT metric_name, result FROM sampling_metrics WHERE calculation_method = 'mean' ORDER BY result DESC;
SELECT * FROM sampling_techniques;
SELECT method, target_table FROM sampling_techniques WHERE id = 1;
SELECT sample_name, sample_size, sampling_method FROM sampled_data WHERE data_id = 1;
SELECT dataset_name, dataset_size FROM balanced_datasets WHERE dataset_type = 'Training';
SELECT param_name, param_value FROM sampling_params;
SELECT * FROM sampling_params WHERE param_value > 0.5
SELECT dataset_name, dataset_size FROM balanced_datasets ORDER BY dataset_size DESC
SELECT sample_name FROM sampled_data WHERE sample_size > 100 ORDER BY sample_size ASC
SELECT method, target_table FROM sampling_techniques WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5)
SELECT * FROM sampling_params sp JOIN sampled_data sd ON sp.param_id = sd.sample_size ORDER BY sp.param_name
SELECT * FROM dataset_samples ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT feature_1, feature_2, label FROM stratified_sampling WHERE label = TRUE;
SELECT id, feature_1, feature_2 FROM systematic_sampling WHERE feature_1 > 0.5 ORDER BY feature_2 ASC;
SELECT * FROM random_sampling WHERE feature_1 < 0.5 AND feature_2 > 0.7;
SELECT id, feature_2 FROM undersampling WHERE label = FALSE ORDER BY feature_2 DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, feature_1, label FROM dataset_samples ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM stratified_sampling WHERE label = TRUE;
SELECT id, feature_1, feature_2 FROM systematic_sampling WHERE feature_1 > 0.5 AND feature_2 < 0.3;
SELECT id, feature_1, label FROM random_sampling WHERE feature_1 BETWEEN 0.2 AND 0.8 ORDER BY feature_1 ASC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM undersampling WHERE label = FALSE;
